thread.title: UMass at Bowling Green
thread.title_full: UMass at Bowling Green | Boston Herald

author: John Connolly
title: UMass at Bowling Green
text:
2 p.m. — Doyt Perry Stadium, Bowling Green, Ohio
TV: ESPN3 (online)
Radio: WATD 95.9-FM, WXKS 1200-AM, WCRN 830-AM
THREE THINGS TO WATCH
1. UMass senior Tajae Sharpe needs 190 receiving yards to pass Adrian Zullo (2,892 from 1998-2002) and become the program’s career leader. Sharpe also needs two receiving touchdowns to tie career leader Chip Mitchell (1986-89) with 14. Sharpe’s 39-game streak with at least one catch is the third-longest active streak behind Arizona State’s D.J. Foster (45), and Toledo’s Alonzo Russell (42).
2. Get a stopwatch! Eight of the Minutemen’s 12 touchdown drives in 2015 required two minutes or less. The 66.7-percent rate ties UMass with Baylor at No. 2 nationally, behind only Troy.
3. Did someone say offense? UMass is averaging 445 total yards, though that pales in comparison to the Falcons, who are averaging a whopping 580.6 yards per game.
